Articles.Content:
Among the improved modding features mentioned on the KSP2 webpage, there must be a DDS/MU editor to create new parts easier, and an integrated planet editing code so we can add/edit planets/moons/stars without needing a "background mod" (such as Kopernicus for KSP1) for this.

Edited September 12, 2021 by qwery123
That's the impression I got when they said it will be "easier for modders". Especially in terms of adding new stars and planets, seeing as there will be other star systems with exoplanets.

What I'd really like is a Mod Manager built in.
 Install all your mods to a particular folder, they all go into subfolders, and then the Mod Manager gives you each mod, and a tickybox to enable or disable.  So if you install till you break it, you can deselect a mod, restart, see if its that one that's causing a crash, etc. 

Would be a nice quality of life improvement, I suspect.
Yes, Module Mananger is needed for mest other mods, so it needs to be integrated into vanilla.
